This is a really great NTR. I honestly feel bad for the brothers. The character I found to be terrible was the girl. She’s leading on two guys, one for sex, and the other for marriage. It’s interesting seeing other perspectives, @torjak said something really interesting, “Speaking of improvement, the girl is the only one who did something worthwhile. She wants their sex life to improve, she seeks help. Meanwhile the two brothers are just meh. Elder one lazy in sex, younger one lazy in choosing for himself.”

Odd how negative the reception for this was, I thought it was really good. The story isn't as mindless as most netorare, and the fact that it was written by Unou already guarantees a score greater than 8/10 in the art and sex scenes department. My lack of disgust for this is probably rooted in my apathy for ideas like marriage. It just seems like a way of owning people, and it is an antiquated idea. Not to say that one can not choose to do so, but it leaves both parties vulnerable to abuse in all areas, and a feeling of obligation may stop people from escaping their marriage, though this has thankfully been stopped by the destigmatization of divorce. Human beings are not breeding mares/semen dispensers, after all. In this case, the woman ought to have broken up the relationship before getting married.

Gah, I hate open endings like this that a lot of NTR stories thrive on. Taking a page to show the consequences of getting caught(Megumi losing the comfort and security that hubby provided through divorce and Yuu getting tossed out on his ass along with the big bro snitching to his parents to deny him a place to stay) is so much better than these "use your imagination" endings like this.

@metroid Unou, while having work published with them is not officially signed or part of the writing team at Comic Tenma, they adopted stories from him freelance.While I will give that you are right in this  work as I said "AFAIK" he wasn't signed, which btw still holds true, they did take work from him. It doesn't change that most of his works are self published and would be considered doujin,  so I was wrong for not knowing this piece was published in Tenma. It's not a matter of the title, the tags on this site are often missed or incorrect and there was no indication, so I spoke out of ignorance of that. I do know the difference between manga and doujin, blame lack of citing sources/credit not knowing what a doujin is. So can you quit being an asshat now?
